intro: Apodanthes flacourtiae, commonly known as the Flacourtia flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
